azureLogAnalytics.query:
customMetrics
| where name == "process.memory.usage"
| where instance=cloud_RoleInstance in ("SQM-NETCORE-ADM")
| project timestamp, name=cloud_RoleInstance, value
| order by timestamp asc

customMetrics
| where name == "process.memory.usage"
| where instance=cloud_RoleInstance in ("SQLMONITOR-BM1", "SQLMONITOR-TEST", "SQM-NETCORE-BM1", "EC2AMAZ-L4FVIBT")
| project timestamp, name=cloud_RoleInstance, value
| order by timestamp asc

panels.title: Admin Base Monitor Process Memory Usage

azureLogAnalytics.query:
customMetrics
| where name == "process.memory.usage"
| where instance=cloud_RoleInstance in ("SQM-NETCORE-WEB")
| project timestamp, name=cloud_RoleInstance, value
| order by timestamp asc

options.content: Base Monitors on **SQLMONITOR-TEST** and **SQM-NETCORE-BM1** are shared between Admin site and Readonly Site.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
customMetrics
| where name == "process.memory.usage"
| where instance=cloud_RoleInstance in ("SQLMONITOR-BM1", "SQLMONITOR-TEST", "SQM-NETCORE-BM2")
| project timestamp, name=cloud_RoleInstance, value
| order by timestamp asc

panels.title: Readonly Base Monitor Process Memory Usage

panels.description: This visualization is not working, yet

azureLogAnalytics.query:
customMetrics
| where name == "dotnet.process.cpu.time"
| where cloud_RoleInstance in ("SQLMONITOR-BM1", "SQLMONITOR-TEST", "SQM-NETCORE-BM2")
| project timestamp, value, valueCount, cloud_RoleInstance, itemId
// We sometimes get multiple values for the same instant - not sure but assuming they should be summed
// Maybe something to do with multiple CPUs or similar?
| summarize val=sum(value) by moment=bin(timestamp, 1s), cloud_RoleInstance
| partition by cloud_RoleInstance ( 
    sort by moment asc 
    | extend delta= min_of(max_of(val - prev(val, 1), 0),100) // clamp values to avoid too much noise from outliers
    )
| project moment, name=cloud_RoleInstance, delta
| order by moment asc
//

panels.title: CPU time [ Work In Progress ]

panels.description: This visualization is not working, yet

dotnet.monitor.lock_contentions

azureLogAnalytics.query:
customMetrics
//| where name == "dotnet.thread_pool.work_item.count"
| where name == "dotnet.monitor.lock_contentions"
| where cloud_RoleInstance in ("SQM-NETCORE-BM1", "SQLMONITOR-TEST", "SQM-NETCORE-BM2", "EC2AMAZ-L4FVIBT")
//| project timestamp, value, instance=cloud_RoleInstance, customDimensions["service.name"]
| project timestamp, value, valueCount, cloud_RoleInstance, itemId
| summarize val=sum(value) by moment=bin(timestamp, 1s), cloud_RoleInstance//, itemId
| partition by cloud_RoleInstance ( 
    sort by moment asc 
    | extend delta= min_of(max_of(val - prev(val, 1), 0),500) // clamp to minimize impact of outliers
    )
| project moment, name=cloud_RoleInstance, delta
| order by moment asc
// | take 100

azureLogAnalytics.query:
// Grafana does not seem to like this query very much. Something wrong with the time range?!? 
// But also the data is weird - seem to get lots of duplicates for long periods of time, leadning to strange plateauing graphs?!?
customMetrics
| where cloud_RoleInstance == "SQM-NETCORE-ADM"
| where name == "http.server.request.duration"
| where timestamp > ago(12h) // in here because of Grafana time-range weirdness
| summarize maxDuration=percentile(value, 95) by minute=bin(timestamp, 10m), name=tostring(customDimensions["http.request.method"])
| order by minute asc

panels.title: SQM-NETCORE-ADM [ Work In Progress ]
